definition: loyal and devoted (idiom); faithful and true

sentences.english: But Daniel was blameless , for he was loyal to both God and the King.
sentences.chinese: 可但以理对王对上帝都忠心耿耿，无可挑剔。

sentences.english: Sharp intention cures, utterly loyal, is a talented individual on the political.
sentences.chinese: 锐意图治，忠心耿耿，政治上是一位干才。

sentences.english: He often treated his friends badly; butt t hey remained loyal tot he last.
sentences.chinese: 他经常不善待朋友，但朋友们却始终对他忠心耿耿。

sentences.english: Both children seem very loyal to their adoptive mother.
sentences.chinese: 两个孩子似乎都对他们的养母忠心耿耿。

sentences.english: He has 20 years of loyal service to Barclays Bank behind him.
sentences.chinese: 他已经忠心耿耿地为巴克莱银行效力了20年。

definition: to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to vow loyalty and devotion to
lit. the kindness of recognizing sb's worth and employing him (idiom)/patronage/protection
under one's control or administration/subordinates/(money etc) on hand/sb's financial means/to take action
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
lit. red-bellied devotion (idiom); wholehearted loyalty/to serve sb with body and soul
